note: Distinctive Châteauneuf, with plenty of wild mushrooms, wet earth, game and leather. This is not a fruit bomb; it has chewy tannins. But underneath is wonderful sweet fruit, as well as a subtle mineral caress. Something special. Best from 2005 through 2015. 13,330 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Cinq Cépages
note: Gorgeous Cabernet, offering a mix of ripe, rich, fleshy currant and blackberry fruit, with hints of herb, olive and sage. Finishes with a firm, structured backbone and ripe tannins giving it depth and richness. Drink now through 2014. 13,000 cases made.

A Brunello for everyone. Solid and focused, with mineral, blackberry and licorice character. Full-bodied and very chunky, with lots of round tannins and a long, long finish. Needs time to open. Best after 2003. 32,500 cases made.

A tour de force. Deliciously rich and complex, with layers of juicy plum, black cherry, currant and wild berry shaded by anise, cedar, earth and mineral flavors, it fairly gushes with fruit on the finish, yet should age gracefully for another decade, maybe more. Best from 2004 through 2015. 5,067 cases made.

An immense effort, dark, rich and deeply concentrated, packed with layers of rich currant, chocolate, mocha, cherry and herbal nuances. Finishes with a powerful, persistent aftertaste, rich, ripe tannins and wonderful complexity. Best from 2003 through 2012. 12,280 cases made.

Dusty berry, currant, anise and cedary oak aromas follow through to a rich, concentrated core of flavors on the palate; yet for all its weight, there's a sense of suppleness and grace, with a rich curranty aftertaste. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,240 cases made.

wine_full: Brunello di Montalcino Pian delle Vigne
note: Amazing Brunello. Fantastic aromas of blackberries, flowers and minerals. Captivating. Full-bodied, with incredible layers of ripe fruit and silky tannins. The finish last for minutes. Racy and firm now. Give it some bottle age. Best from 2004 through 2014. 12,000 cases made.

Superbly crafted. Pretty aromas of black cherry, cream and licorice. Full-bodied, yet incredibly tight and smooth, with ultrafine tannins and a long, long, velvety finish. Best after 2004. 12,000 cases made.

Big wine, but so refined and sleek, it comes across as delicate on the palate. Plenty of finely tuned oak, with vanilla, chocolate and mocha aromas that blend into the sweet red and blackberry to produce a classy and satiny wine that is surprisingly aristocratic for this appellation. Like a charming red Burgundy from Chambolle-Musigny. Drink now through 2010. 17,165 cases made.

Warm and exciting wine from a slightly frigid vintage. Black ruby color. Rich and powerful nose, with loads of currant, smoke and tobacco. Full-bodied and silky, polished and long. Best after 2005. 15,000 cases made.

A wine of great intensity, depth and complexity. Beautifully crafted, ripe, rich and creamy, showing off pretty vanilla and mocha-scented oak before a deep core of currant, blackberry, black cherry and minerally flavors fold in. Firm tannins add structure on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2014. 7,000 cases made.

An enormously complex and sophisticated wine that combines great flavors with uncommon finesse. Dark, sleek, rich and polished, with a delicious core of concentrated cola, currant, plum and blackberry. Tremendous finish. Best from 2004 through 2014. 20,000 cases made.

Complex aromas of blackberries, tobacco, spices and black licorice are alluring in this full-bodied claret, with a solid core of fruit and silky tannins. Long, caressing finish. Superfine, well-structured. Best after 2006. 22,500 cases made.

Breathtaking. Big and powerful, with loads of plum, blackberry, raisin and meat aromas. Full-bodied, with big, luscious tannins and masses of fruit on the palate. Long and rich. Seductive. Best after 2007. 1,400 cases made.

Sleek, yet deceptively rich and complex. Deeply concentrated and full of ripe fig, pear, citrus, light toasty oak and hazelnut flavors. Sharply focused and long on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,800 cases made.

Rich and creamy, a plush mouthful of peach, pear, nutmeg and cream flavors that wind themselves nicely all the way through the generous finish. Inexpensive and more than plentiful. Drink now through 2003. 185,000 cases made.

Ultrasmooth and gently spicy, a gorgeous rainbow of plum, cherry, cedar, chocolate and exotic spice flavors that play across a supple frame, polished to a deep sheen and echoing forever. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

Rich and spicy, with exotic chocolate, black cherry, plum, nutmeg and light toasty, mocha-scented oak and coffee grounds. Elegant, complex and concentrated, it's a mouthful of Merlot that should age well for another decade. Firm, chewy tannins sneak up on you. Best from 2003 through 2012. 27,000 cases made.

Full-throttle Chardonnay, with all the Burgundy treatment (like a juicy Meursault) you could hope for. Loads of apple, vanilla and pineapple character. Full-bodied, with loads of fruit and a long, butterscotch and ripe fruit aftertaste. Glorious. Drink now. 6,700 cases made.

Delicious black cherry, spicy plum and blackberry flavors are well-centered, offering depth and richness and finishing with firm tannins wrapped around a core of mocha-laced oak. Drink now through 2009. 16,934 cases made.

wine_full: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna di Pianrosso
note: Beautiful, with blackberry, perfumed violet and milk chocolate aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of jammy, chocolaty fruit and big, velvety tannins. Lasts for minutes on the palate. Glorious now, but will age for a very long time. Best after 2004. 2,500 cases made.

Complex aromas of grilled meat and cherry, with hints of cedar and tobacco turning to plums and flowers. Full-bodied and extremely well-structured, with well-integrated tannins and ripe and concentrated fruit. Superbly made. Best after 2004. 2,200 cases made.

Fantastic. Very ripe and rich, with raisin and cured beef character. Full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. A massive but impressive red. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best after 2005. 3,250 cases made.

Like finely meshed cashmere. Exotic aromas of plums, incense and Indian spices. Full-bodied, with very fine tannins and a long, caressing, silky aftertaste. A wine with loads of finesse. Give it time. Best after 2004. 4,580 cases made.

With firm texture and beautiful focus, this powerful, seamless wine has a distinctly gamy note weaving through the ripe, peppery currant and plum flavors. Finishes with chewy tannins. Best from 2004 through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

Deceptively sleek, rich and polished for all its youthful vitality and intensity. Packed with rich currant, cherry, mocha and coffee flavors, it has a deep, complex midpalate, and then the tannins flex their considerable muscles. Best from 2003 through 2012. 4,100 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District Estate
note: Absolutely gorgeous, beautifully defined fruit, with uncommon richness and purity of flavor, gushing with ripe currant, blackberry and wild berry fruit, revealing extra facets and dimensions, with a long, intricate, detailed finish. Firmly tannic, but a wealth of fruit pushes through. Best from 2003 through 2012. 1,300 cases made.

Wonderfully rich, intense and concentrated Cabernet, with layers of tightly focused currant, black cherry, anise, sage and cedary oak. Given all its flavor and richness, there's a sense of elegance and finesse. Well-integrated tannins provide an excellent balance to the rich flavors. Best from 2003 through 2012. 2,443 cases made.

Deliciously rich, smooth and polished. Deeply concentrated, with layers of currant, blackberry, mocha and vanilla. Beautifully focused and deftly balanced, the flavors run on and on. Best from 2004 through 2013. 2,164 cases made.

Smooth, rich and elegant. This is a supple, deeply flavored, harmonious wine, with focused currant, cassis and blackberry flavors that are pure and succulent. Finishing with ripe, well-integrated tannins and a burst of fruit. Drink now through 2012. 6,950 cases made.
Plump and generous, dark-colored and amazingly supple, offering pretty plum, blackberry and sweet spice flavors that linger on the polished finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

Rich in flavor and beautifully focused to show its currant, plum and berry flavors, which cascade juicily and generously on the long, long finish. All of it balances impeccably. Drink now through 2008. 2,030 cases made.

Brilliant, juicy and multilayered, brimming with apple, pear, tropical fruit, almond, mineral and spice flavors that swirl together on a muscular but lithe and seamless frame. The flavors last and last. Has depth, length and power without being at all bulky. Drink now through 2011. 3,000 cases made.

One whiff and you know this is serious stuff. The aromas of baking brioche, coconut, candied citrus and leather pick up roasted coffee and grilled nuts on the palate, permeating the senses. Profound depth and complexity, offering a unique Champagne experience. Drink now through 2006. 40,000 cases made.

Dark, rich and enormously complex, with a solid core of black cherry, plum, currant, anise and cedar flavors. Beautifully focused, with a sense of elegance and finesse. Best from 2003 through 2010. 8,400 cases made.

Smooth-textured, with polished currant, mocha, cranberry and cherry, plus touches of tobacco, coffee and spice. A bit tough-edged with tannin, but certainly not out of line for a young wine. Best from 2003 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

A bit more aristocratic than most Aussie Shirazes, this one strikes a beautiful chord of rich blackberry and currant fruit, hinting at anise and pepper. Has a fleshy frame, with sweet spicy notes darting in and out through the long, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

A gentle giant of a wine. Subtle and elegant Hermitage, layered with seductive aromas and flavors, from tobacco to green olive, roasted game, mineral and blackberries. Silky mouthfeel, this medium-bodied red is smooth, yet also fresh on the long finish. Will age for years. Drink now through 2015. 7,330 cases made.
Very well-done. Bright fruit, with hints of dry porcini that turn to blackberries. Full-bodied, with loads of silky tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2005. 1,600 cases made.

Smooth and generous, an inviting red that's plump with black cherry, blackberry and exotic spice flavors, hinting at dark chocolate as the flavors persist on the fine-grained finish. Outstanding. Drink now through 2004. 20,000 cases made.

Fantastic white. Lovely aromas of fresh green apples, grapefruit and peaches. Full-bodied and very rich, with intense fruit and a long, long finish. A super Soave. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made.

Clearly made in Burgundy, this is a savage wine, a highly distinctive Chardonnay. Immensely powerful, penetrating the palate with a concentrated lemon, honey, wet earth, ripe fruit combination. Full-bodied, it lasts for over a minute on the finish. Best from 2004 through 2020. 1,300 cases made.

A rich, deftly balanced style, loaded with complex earthy currant, black cherry, anise, coffee and mocha flavors that are sharply focused. Long and concentrated on the finish, with a leathery streak working its way in. Best from 2003 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

Very rich and distinctive, with spicy currant, leather, tobacco, cedar and mocha aromas and complex, concentrated, earth, currant, spice and cedar flavors. Gains depth and nuance on the finish, where the flavors run deep and long. Tannins are firm and well-integrated. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made.

Jazzy, snazzy and vibrant. A juicy mouthful of grapefruit, pear and sweet pea, with aromas and flavors that linger on and on, as the finish finds a wonderful equilibrium. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

wine_full: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Dijon Clones
note: A bold mouthful of Chardonnay that packs in lots of rich, complex flavors that are concentrated and deep. Smoky toasty oak, pear, fig, sage and anise turn thick and buttery. Drink now through 2006. 15,000 cases made.

A well-rounded, balanced sparkler, showing hazelnut, citrus and honey flavors, augmented by toast, well-integrated with the medium body and lively structure. Drink now through 2004. 50,000 cases imported.

wine_full: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Red Shoulder Ranch
note: Intense and spicy, with an underlying sense of elegance and finesse. Layers of nutmeg and cedary oak match up well with a core of ripe pear, fig, citrus and apricot, finishing with a long, rich, complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 7,000 cases made.

Dark, rich and polished, with ripe currant, black cherry, plum and mocha. It's dense and concentrated, with a long, focused and persistent stream of flavors. Ripe tannins are plush and complex. Best from 2004 through 2012. 9,200 cases made.

Big and ripe red, with loads of black licorice, tar and sultanas. Full-bodied, with big, velvety, chewy tannins. Long, ripe fruit aftertaste. A blockbuster. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2005. 3,750 cases made.

wine_full: Merlot Columbia Valley Canoe Ridge Estate Vineyard
note: Rich, round and generous with its ripe blackberry, cherry and sweet spice flavors, which echo beautifully on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2006. 10,000 cases made.
Bright, ripe and zingy, with grapefruit, pear and celery notes that linger enticingly through the vivid finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

A big, ripe, expressive style that packs in lots of spicy blackberry and black cherry fruit, and manages a measure of elegance and finesse given its size and intensity. Finishes with hints of herb and tea. Drink now through 2009. 4,000 cases made.
Lively, jazzy style absolutely brims with racy lime, green apple, passion fruit and guava flavors, which linger effortlessly on the polished, vibrant finish. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

Silky, supple and creamy, beautifully balanced to layer its intense nectarine, pear, lime and cream flavors, which linger effortlessly on the elegant finish. Drink now through 2008. 14,390 cases imported.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Marqués de Casa Concha
note: Delicious Old World-style Cab, with ripe currant and cassis fruit accentuated by mineral, loam, smoke and earth notes. Ripe and juicy, with lovely mouthfeel, and the tug of gout de terroir on the finish. Back-to-back outstanding efforts for this wine. Drink now through 2005. 24,500 cases made.

Rich and intense, highly focused to project its aromas and flavors without being heavy. Centers on dazzling raspberry, blackberry, vanilla and roasted game notes that harmonize beautifully on the lively finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,700 cases made.

Dark and intense, with a tight, compact, tightly wound band of earth, anise, leather, game meat, currant and blackberry, revealing layers of complexity and concentration before the tannins and cedary oak clamp down. Best from 2005 through 2014. 2,000 cases made.
Pretty aromas of plums, berries and cherries follow through to a full-bodied palate, with a lovely balance of ripe fruit and refined tannins. Long and caressing finish. Drink now. 5,380 cases made.
Rich, concentrated yet elegant style, with waves of ripe flavors, supple coffee, currant, black cherry and anise, finishing with dense tannins. Drink now through 2010. 6,400 cases made.
Delicious stuff. Juicy, with fig, pineapple and pear flavors, fat texture, and a long, bright finish that lets the flavors hang on. Drink now through 2003. 14,000 cases made.
Bright and juicy, this white is a lively mouthful of melon, citrus, pepper and passion fruit flavors, which linger on the appealing finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.
A particularly generous New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc that jumps with ripe pear, citrus and passion fruit aromas and flavors, remarkable for its intensity and freshness. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

Beautiful aromas of minerals, berries and violets, with just the right amount of toasted oak. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins, but slightly austere on the finish. Best after 2002. 14,000 cases made.

Dark, intense and concentrated, with a beefy, peppery edge to the plush currant, mineral, earth and blackberry. Shows of lots of flavor and depth, finishing with a strong currant and mineral aftertaste, and rich tannins. Best from 2004 through 2012. 1,473 cases made.

So sleek and clean, this full-bodied red combines beautifully spicy fruit, black currant, licorice and a touch of eucalyptus. Light-footed, it glides on the palate to a long and elegant finish. Seductive. Drink now through 2007. 1,220 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Monte Rosso Vineyard Family Vineyard Selection
note: Impressive for its rich, tight, deeply concentrated core of spice- and anise-laced currant and blackberry flavors. Sharply focused, intense and concentrated, its mouthfilling fruit flavors are long and complex on the finish, with well-integrated tannins. Best from 2004 through 2014. 1,365 cases made.

Bright and tangy, with an uncanny balance that finds the right mix of peach, pear and mineral flavors, juicy but nicely concealed acidity, and enough richness to make it all sing through the long, elegant finish. Drink now through 2007. 10,000 cases made.
Gorgeous aromas of blackberries, violets and currants lead to this full-bodied wine with velvety tannins. Lovely finish delivers a juicy berry aftertaste. Best after 2004. 16,000 cases made.

A supple, elegant style, with a range of herb, currant and green olive that offers complexity, picking up anise, earth and mineral flavors. Pleasantly balanced on the finish. A wine of grace and delicacy. Drink now through 2009. 9,800 cases made.

A wine of finesse and elegance, with intense, vibrant fruit that's ripe and rich, with layers of smoky toasty oak, honeysuckle, fig and melon, turning subtle and polished. Drink now through 2005. 9,630 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Grand Reserve
note: Orchestrates an assortment of ripe cherry, blackberry and currant flavors in a smooth texture. Has fine tannins, picking up toasty, cedary oak on the finish, providing backbone. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,500 cases made.

Bright and tangy, a complex and detailed Pinot that sneaks up on you. It is especially appealing for its citrus-scented raspberry and chocolate flavors, which linger effortlessly on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,902 cases made.

wine_full: Chardonnay Napa Valley Sbragia Limited Release
note: A rich, complex and deeply concentrated style, with layers of pear, fig, smoke, apricot and honey. Bold and intriguing, it's a mouthful of Chardonnay that both relies on oak and carries it well. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

Gorgeous from start to finish. An explosive wine that delivers lemon, ripe fruit, and toasted oak (in manageable doses). Sweet-tasting, but with an impressive mineral note. Beautiful, long, succulent finish. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases imported.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Appellation Selection
note: Wonderful richness, depth and purity of flavor. Shows layers of black cherry, ripe plum, raspberry and currant, as well as touches of anise and herb. Vanilla and cedar-scented oak linger in the background. Ripe tannins emerge on the long, complex, elegant finish. Best from 2003 through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

A ripe, intense, fruit-driven style, with racy, jammy black cherry and blackberry fruit that's well-focused, picking up pretty toasty oak, tar and leather shadings. Holds its focus nicely. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made.

This Portuguese red bursts in the mouth with intense flavors of cassis, berry and red cherry that are powered by a strong backbone of acidity. Finish of game and bittersweet chocolate. Almost Burgundian in its elegance and balance. Best from 2003 through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Vintage Selection
note: Ripe, rich and polished, with a tasty array of complex currant, plum and wild berry flavors that are sharply focused, long and detailed on the finish. Tannins are sufficient for cellaring, yet neatly woven into the texture. Beautifully crafted. Best from 2003 through 2012. 6,200 cases made.
Intense aromas of ripe fruit, flowers and hints of wood. Full-bodied, with rich, silky tannins and a long, long finish. A tight and well-structured red for aging. Best after 2004. 3,250 cases made.

Ripe, rich and expressive style, with loads of tropical fruit, pear, fig, apricot and buttery oak, all neatly woven together. The texture is smooth and polished, with a long, detailed, citrusy aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 13,400 cases made.

Distinctive, packed with currant, cocoa, mineral and meat flavors, followed by ripe, finely grained tannins and a lingering espresso note on the lengthy finish. Concentrated, yet elegant and pure, with grip to spare. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2003 through 2007. 4,600 cases made.
Rich, elegant and stylish, with pretty hazelnut, toasty marshmallow, pear, fig and citrus flavors that are nicely proportioned. Drink now through 2007. 3,600 cases made.

Wonderful aromas of apple pie, honey and cream follow through to a full body, with toasted coconut and rich tropical fruit on the palate. Very long. Always an excellent white. Chardonnay and Grechetto. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

Rich, complex, refined yet flavor-packed style, with lots of rich pear, fig, hazelnut and melon flavors accented by spicy, toasty oak. Finishes with a long, detailed aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 60,000 cases made.

Smooth and silky, with ripe, rich blackberry, currant and black cherry flavors that are pure and well-focused. Finishes with a long, concentrated aftertaste, with elegant tannins. Drink now through 2009. 50,000 cases made.
Rich and ripe, plush in texture, brimming with cherry, mineral and licorice flavors, wrapping extrafine tannins around the long finish. Drink now through 2006. 13,000 cases imported.

Displays very good concentration for the vintage. Aromatic, with plum, currant and tar character, the wine is medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a medium finish. Super buy. Best after 2003. 21,665 cases made.

Rich and delicious, a lip-smacking mouthful of blackberry, currant, blueberry and plum flavors wrapped in a blanket of exotic spices, with hints of coffee and chocolate. Tannins are fine and chewy. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

A richly flavored yet elegantly crafted wine that's sleek and polished, with ripe pear, fig, honeysuckle and honeydew flavors that turn smooth and creamy, picking up subtle nutmeg and hazelnut nuances on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,466 cases made.

An outstanding modern-style wine from an ancient Italian grape variety. Wonderful aromas of blanched almonds, dried peach, pineapple and minerals. Medium- to full-bodied, with lovely fresh fruit, flinty character and a long, long finish. Excellent. Drink now. 66,650 cases made.

Beautiful aromas of sweet plums, licorice and minerals. Full-bodied, with lots of vanilla and berry character, fine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Delicious. Give it some time to come together. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2004. 10,415 cases made.
Clean and balanced. Beautiful aromas of plums, flowers and fresh-brewed Indian tea. Medium-bodied, with ultrafine tannins and a long, caressing finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 20,000 cases made.

This luscious red offers vanilla, rose and berry aromas that carry through on the creamy palate. Ripe tannins underpin the fruit, but melt into the mix. A spicy, floral finish brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2007. 18,000 cases made.

Powerful oaky flavors dominate this red now, but they wrap around a core of luscious raspberry and blackberry fruit flavors, and the texture is smooth and opulent. An ambitious wine in the modern style. Carignane, Grenache, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,300 cases made.

Very fine indeed, offering complex aromas of berries, grilled meat and tobacco, with racy tannins and a long finish. Medium- to full-bodied. Better than from barrel. Best after 2005. 18,715 cases made.

wine_full: Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León
note: Harmony and finesse mark this elegant red. It offers black cherry, toast and spice flavors over firm tannins, with a grace that almost hides its intensity. A lovely wine in the modern style. Drink now through 2009. 13,000 cases made.
Pretty berry and spicy aromas follow through to a medium to full body, with well-integrated tannins and a coffee, plum and truffle aftertaste. Best after 2005. 7,200 cases made.

Rich and ripe, packed with beautiful currant and berry flavors, framed with superfine tannins that let the fruit and subtly spicy overtones linger effortlessly on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,329 cases made.
Incredibly well-crafted red. Complex aromas of raspberries, vanilla and coffee. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, silky finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 4,250 cases made.
